original: Cell signaling, also known as cellular communication, refers to the processes by which cells receive, process, and transmit signals to and from their environment and among themselves. Signals can be categorized into non-chemical types, such as light, electrical impulses, and heat, as well as chemical signals, commonly referred to as ligands. These ligands interact with receptors, which may be located on the cell membrane or within the i
